intro: Cyphostemma kirkianum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by bright orange to red berries. It is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Cyphostemma kirkianum is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional African medicine.
